pli-tv-kd12:0.3: The chapter on those on probation
pli-tv-kd12:0.4: 1. The proper conduct for those on probation
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.2: At that time monks on probation consented to regular monks bowing down to them, standing up for them, raising their joined palms to them, doing acts of respect toward them, offering them a seat, offering them a bed, offering them water for washing their feet and a foot stool, offering them a foot scraper, receiving their bowls and robes, and massaging their backs when bathing.
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.3: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.4: “How can monks on probation consent to these things?”
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.6: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.7: “Is it true, monks, that the monks on probation are consenting to these things?”
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.11: How can monks on probation consent to these things?
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.14: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.15: “A monk on probation shouldn’t consent to:
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.16: Regular monks bowing down to him;
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.17: Regular monks standing up for him;
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.18: Regular monks raising their joined palms to him;
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.19: Regular monks doing acts of respect toward him;
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.20: Regular monks offering him a seat;
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.21: Regular monks offering him a bed;
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.22: Regular monks offering him water for washing his feet and a foot stool;
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.23: Regular monks offering him a foot scraper;
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.24: Regular monks receiving his bowl and robe;
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.25: Regular monks massaging his back when he’s bathing.
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.26: If he consents to any of these, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.27: Monks on probation should do the following with one another according to seniority: bow down, stand up, raise their joined palms, do acts of respect, offer a seat, offer a bed, offer water for washing the feet and a foot stool, offer a foot scraper, receive bowl and robe, and massage one another’s backs when bathing.
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.28: Monks on probation should do five things with regular monks according to seniority:
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.29: the observance-day ceremony, the invitation ceremony, distributing rainy-season robes, meal invitations, and meals.
pli-tv-kd12:1.1.30: And now I will lay down the proper conduct for a monk on probation.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.3: He shouldn’t give the full ordination.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.5: He shouldn’t have a novice monk attend on him.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.6: He shouldn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.7: Even if appointed, he shouldn’t instruct the nuns.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.8: He shouldn’t commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha gave him probation, nor one that’s similar or worse.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.9: He shouldn’t criticize the legal procedure.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.10: He shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.11: He shouldn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.12: He shouldn’t cancel the invitation of a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.13: He shouldn’t direct a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.14: He shouldn’t give instructions to a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd12:1.2.17: He shouldn’t remind a regular monk of an offense.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.18: He shouldn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.19: He shouldn’t walk in front of a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.20: He shouldn’t sit in front of a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.21: He should be given the last seat, the last bed, and the last dwelling of the Sangha, and he should consent to that.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.22: He shouldn’t attend on a regular monk when going to families.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.23: He shouldn’t be attended on by a regular monk when going to families.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.24: He shouldn’t undertake the practice of staying in the wilderness.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.25: He shouldn’t undertake the practice of eating only almsfood.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.26: He shouldn’t have someone bring back almsfood for him because he doesn’t want others to know about his status.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.27: He should inform about his status when he’s newly arrived in a monastery.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.28: He should inform new arrivals of his status.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.29: He should inform about his status on the observance day.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.30: He should inform about his status on the invitation day.
pli-tv-kd12:1.2.31: If he’s sick, he should inform about his status by messenger.

pli-tv-kd12:2.1.1: Soon afterwards Venerable Upāli went to the Buddha,
pli-tv-kd12:2.1.4: “How many things are there, Venerable Sir, that stop a monk on probation from counting a particular day toward his probationary period?”
pli-tv-kd12:2.1.6: he stays in the same room as a regular monk; he stays apart from other monks; he doesn’t inform other monks of his status.”
pli-tv-kd12:3.1.1: On one occasion a large sangha of monks had gathered at Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-kd12:3.1.2: The monks on probation were unable to fulfill their probationary duties.
pli-tv-kd12:3.1.4: “I allow you to set aside the probation.
pli-tv-kd12:3.1.5: And it should be done like this.
pli-tv-kd12:3.1.6: The monk on probation should approach a monk, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
pli-tv-kd12:3.1.9: or ‘I set aside the proper conduct.’”
pli-tv-kd12:3.2.1: Soon afterwards the monks at Sāvatthī left for various destinations.
pli-tv-kd12:3.2.2: The monks on probation were once again able to fulfill their probationary duties.
pli-tv-kd12:3.2.4: “I allow you to take up the probation.

pli-tv-kd12:3.2.9: or ‘I take up the proper conduct.’”
pli-tv-kd12:3.2.11: The proper conduct for those on probation is finished.
pli-tv-kd12:4.1.0: 2. The proper conduct for those deserving to be sent back to the beginning
pli-tv-kd12:4.1.1: At this time monks deserving to be sent back to the beginning consented to regular monks bowing down to them, standing up for them, raising their joined palms to them, doing acts of respect toward them, offering them a seat, offering them a bed, offering them water for washing their feet and a foot stool, offering them a foot scraper, receiving their bowls and robes, and massaging their backs when bathing.

pli-tv-kd12:5.1.0: 3. The proper conduct for those deserving the trial period
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.1: At this time monks deserving the trial period consented to regular monks bowing down to them, standing up for them, raising their joined palms to them, doing acts of respect toward them, offering them a seat, offering them a bed, offering them water for washing their feet and a foot stool, offering them a foot scraper, receiving their bowls and robes, and massaging their backs when bathing.
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.2: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.3: “How can monks deserving the trial period consent to these things?”
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.4: The monks told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha of monks gathered and questioned them:
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.5: “Is it true, monks, that monks deserving the trial period consent to these things?”
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.9: How can monks deserving the trial period consent to these things?

pli-tv-kd12:5.1.16.1: Regular monks raising their joined palms to him;
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.16.2: Regular monks doing acts of respect for him;
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.16.3: Regular monks offering him a seat;
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.16.4: Regular monks offering him a bed;
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.16.5: Regular monks offering him water for washing his feet and a foot-stool;
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.16.6: Regular monks offering him a foot-scraper;
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.16.7: Regular monks receiving his bowl and robe;
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.17: Regular monks massaging his back when he’s bathing.
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.18: If he consents to any of these, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.19: Monks deserving the trial period should do the following to one another according to seniority: bow down, raise their joined palms, do acts of respect, offer a seat, offer a bed, offer water for washing the feet and a foot stool, offer a foot scraper, receive bowl and robe, and massage one another’s backs when bathing.
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.20: Monks deserving the trial period should do five things with regular monks according to seniority:
pli-tv-kd12:5.1.21: the observance-day ceremony, the invitation ceremony, distributing rainy-season robes, meal invitations, and meals.

pli-tv-kd12:7.1.1: Soon afterwards Venerable Upāli went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,
pli-tv-kd12:7.1.3: “How many things are there, Venerable Sir, that stop a monk undertaking the trial period from counting a particular day toward his trial period?”
pli-tv-kd12:7.1.5: he stays in the same room as a regular monk; he stays apart from other monks; he doesn’t inform other monks of his status; he travels without a group.”
pli-tv-kd12:8.1.1: On one occasion a large sangha of monks had gathered at Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-kd12:8.1.2: The monks undertaking the trial period were unable to fulfill their duties.
pli-tv-kd12:8.1.4: “I allow you to set aside the trial period.
pli-tv-kd12:8.1.5: And it should be done like this.
pli-tv-kd12:8.1.6: The monk undertaking the trial period should approach a monk, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
pli-tv-kd12:8.1.9: or ‘I set aside the proper conduct.’”
pli-tv-kd12:8.1.11: Soon afterwards the monks at Sāvatthī left for various destinations.
pli-tv-kd12:8.1.12: The monks undertaking the trial period were again able to fulfill their duties.
pli-tv-kd12:8.1.14: “I allow you to take up the trial period.
pli-tv-kd12:8.1.15: And it should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd12:8.1.21: The proper conduct for those undertaking the trial period is finished.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.0: 5. The proper conduct for those deserving rehabilitation.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.1: At this time monks deserving rehabilitation consented to regular monks bowing down to them, standing up for them, raising their joined palms to them, doing acts of respect for them, offering them a seat, offering them a bed, offering them water for washing their feet and a foot stool, offering them a foot scraper, receiving their bowls and robes,
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.2: and massaging their backs when bathing.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.3: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.4: “How can monks deserving rehabilitation consent to these things?”
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.6: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.7: “Is it true, monks, that monks deserving rehabilitation consent to these things?”
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.11: How can monks deserving rehabilitation consent to these things?
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.14: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.15: “A monk deserving rehabilitation shouldn’t consent to:
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.16: Regular monks bowing down to him;
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.17.1: Regular monks standing up for him;
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.17.2: Regular monks putting the palms of their hands together for him;
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.17.3: Regular monks doing acts of respect for him;
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.17.4: Regular monks offering him a seat;
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.17.5: Regular monks offering him a bed;
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.17.6: Regular monks offering him water for washing his feet and a foot-stool;
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.17.7: Regular monks offering him a foot-scraper;
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.17.8: Regular monks receiving his bowl and robe;
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.18: Regular monks massaging his back when he’s bathing.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.19: If he consents to any of these, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.20: Monks deserving rehabilitation should do the following to one another according to seniority: bow down, raise their joined palms, do acts of respect, offer a seat, offer a bed, offer water for washing the feet and a foot stool, offer a foot scraper, receive bowl and robe, and massage one another’s backs when bathing.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.21: Monks deserving rehabilitation should do five things with regular monks according to seniority:
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.22: the observance-day ceremony, the invitation ceremony, distributing rainy-season robes, meal invitations, and meals.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.23: And now I will lay down the proper conduct for a monk deserving rehabilitation.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.26: He shouldn’t give the full ordination.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.27.2: He shouldn’t have a novice monk attend on him.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.27.3: He shouldn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.27.4: Even if appointed, he shouldn’t instruct the nuns.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.27.5: He shouldn’t commit the same offense as the offense for which he deserves to be rehabilitated by the Sangha, nor one that is similar or worse.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.27.6: He shouldn’t criticize the legal procedure.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.27.7: He shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.27.8: He shouldn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.27.9: He shouldn’t cancel the invitation of a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.27.10: He shouldn’t direct a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.27.11: He shouldn’t give instructions to a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.27.12: He shouldn’t ask a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.27.13: He shouldn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.27.14: He shouldn’t remind a regular monk of an offense.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.28: He shouldn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.29: He shouldn’t walk in front of a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.30: He shouldn’t sit in front of a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.31: He should be given the last seat, the last bed, and the last dwelling of the Sangha, and he should consent to that.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.32: He shouldn’t attend on a regular monk when going to families
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.33: He shouldn’t be attended on by a regular monk when going to families
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.34: He shouldn’t undertake the practice of staying in the wilderness
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.35: He shouldn’t undertake the practice of eating only almsfood.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.36: He shouldn’t have someone bring back almsfood for him because he doesn’t want others to know about his status.
pli-tv-kd12:9.1.37: He shouldn’t go from a monastery with monks to one without monks, except together with a regular monk or if there are dangers.
